question: Standard of living of a nation can be judged by which of the following?
option1: Increase in GNP at factor cost
option2: Increase in GNP at cost including taxes and duties
option3: Increase in NNP at factor cost
answer: Increase in GNP at factor cost
explanation: GDP per capita only measures the income paid to those residing in the country\'s borders. GNP per capita can raise a country\'s standard of living. That\'s because many citizens live in other countries to get better jobs. They also remit part of their wages back to their families at home.
